data.name: Description
data.value: This is where you type something about your site.

data.name: HardWork
data.value: To sustain this shelter we have to work hard every day, there is no rest and we do fund-raisers. Oh, if there many happy little faces, that makes up for our sacrifice. We also have the support of economic donations, food, cleaning supplies, building materials to rennovate the refuge from people who, like us, love animals and pitch in for our cause. In this journey there have been ups and downs, some furballs have gone over the rainbow bridge, volunteer vets have helped them to leave so they do not continue suffering. There have been painful moments, but it's also very gratifying to see so many furballs enjoy a new home next to a family that loves and cares for them. This is our objective: rescue, cure, and find them a home.

data.name: Information
data.value: So we had to rent a house without light, nor water, and that was how we managed to keep them secure. Over time people joined our cause but they were not constant and gave up. We continue and after some years we have been lent some land and with much effort we have rennovated and we still have much to do with scarce resources. It has become a paradise for them.

data.name: Intro
data.value: Five years ago we started rescuing dogs on Baghdad Beach, animals that were abandoned to their fate. We would take them to our house and improvise shelters with canvas and cardboard so we could to protect them. The neighbors would lend us their covered yard to protect them because our house was not big enough. We had rescued so many that the place was insufficient.

data.name: Mission
data.value: Our mission: that there are no animals wandering the streets left to their fate, gambling with danger and help them to find a family. All the furballs who arrive at the shelter are taken care of by a veterinarian. They are given their vaccines. They are dewormed. They are given treatment if required. They are operated on if they need surgery. They are rehabilitated. They are sterilized and only then are ready for adoption. When necessary, they are tested for the heartworm, and given the Bordetella vaccine. All this costs a lot of money, so we are always in need of help.

data.name: RequirementFive
data.value: Sign an agreement where you agree and take responsibility for the pet from the moment it is delivered to your home, after reviewing your home's conditions.

data.name: RequirementFour
data.value: Keep them up to date on vaccines and dewormed,

data.name: RequirementOne
data.value: First of all, love for animals

data.name: RequirementsLastly
data.value: Further visits will be made eventually to verify the welfare of the adopted animal.

data.name: RequirementThree
data.value: Have shelter to protect them from the weather, not have them tied up, locked up or on the roof

data.name: RequirementTwo
data.value: Have a fenced lawn or patio
